getMetadata()

getMetadata() : \EasyRdf\Resource

Returns resource metadata.

Fetches them from the repository with the loadMetadata() if they were not fetched already.

A deep copy of metadata is returned meaning adjusting the returned object does not automatically affect the resource metadata. Use the setMetadata() method to write back the changes you made.

Returns

\EasyRdf\Resource

See also
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::setMetadata()
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::setGraph()
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::getGraph()

Tags

None found

getGraph()

getGraph() : \EasyRdf\Resource

Returns resource metadata.

Fetches them from the repository with the loadMetadata() if they were not fetched already.

A reference to the metadata is returned meaning adjusting the returned object automatically affects the resource metadata.

Returns

\EasyRdf\Resource

See also
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::setGraph()
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::getMetadata()

Tags

None found

isA()

isA(\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\type  $class) : boolean

Naivly checks if the resource is of a given class.

Naivly means that a given rdfs:type triple must exist in the resource metadata.

Parameters

\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\type $class

Returns

boolean

hasBinaryContent() : boolean

Checks if the resource has the binary content.

Returns

boolean

Tags

None found

setMetadata()

setMetadata(\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\EasyRdf\Resource  $metadata)

Replaces resource metadata with a given RDF resource graph. A deep copy of the provided metadata is stored meaning future modifications of the $metadata object don't affect the resource metadata.

New metadata are not automatically written back to the repository. Use the updateMetadata() method to write them back.

Parameters

\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\EasyRdf\Resource $metadata

See also
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::updateMetadata()
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::setGraph()

Tags

None found

setGraph()

setGraph(\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\EasyRdf\Resource  $resource) : void

Replaces resource metadata with a given RDF resource graph. A reference to the provided metadata is stored meaning future modifications of the $metadata object automatically affect the resource metadata.

New metadata are not automatically written back to the repository. Use the updateMetadata() method to write them back.

Parameters

\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\EasyRdf\Resource $resource

See also
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::updateMetadata()
\acdhOeaw\acdhRepoLib\RepoResource::setMetadata()

Tags

None found

updateMetadata()

updateMetadata(string  $mode = self::UPDATE_MERGE) : void

Saves the object metadata to the repository.

Local metadata are automatically updated with the metadata resulting from the update.

Parameters

string $mode

metadata update mode - one of RepoResource::UPDATE_MERGE, RepoResource::UPDATE_ADD and RepoResource::UPDATE_OVERWRITE

Tags

None found

delete()

delete(boolean  $tombstone = false, boolean  $references = false) : void

Deletes the repository resource.

Parameters

boolean $tombstone

should tombstones be removed for deleted resources?
boolean $references

should references to deleted resources be removed from other resources?

Tags

None found

deleteRecursively()

deleteRecursively(string  $property, boolean  $tombstone = false, boolean  $references = false) : void

Deletes the repository resource as well as all the resources pointing to it with a given metadata property.

The deletion is performed recursively.

Parameters

string $property

property used for the recursive deletion
boolean $tombstone

should tombstones be removed for deleted resources?
boolean $references

should references to deleted resources be removed from other resources?

Tags

None found

loadMetadata()

loadMetadata(boolean  $force = false, string  $mode = self::META_RESOURCE, string  $parentProperty = null)

Loads current metadata from the repository.

Parameters

boolean $force

enforce fetch from Fedora (when you want to make sure metadata are in line with ones in the Fedora or e.g. reset them back to their current state in Fedora)
string $mode

scope of the metadata returned by the repository: RepoResource::META_RESOURCE - only given resource metadata, RepoResource::META_NEIGHBORS - metadata of a given resource and all the resources pointed by its metadata, RepoResource::META_RELATIVES - metadata of a given resource and all resources recursively pointed to a given metadata property (see the $parentProperty parameter), both directly and in a reverse order (reverse in RDF terms)
string $parentProperty

RDF property name used to find related resources in the RepoResource::META_RELATIVES mode

Tags

None found

getId()

getId() : integer

Returns an internal repository resource identifier.

Returns

integer

Tags

None found

parseMetadata()

parseMetadata(\GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response  $resp) : void

Parses metadata fetched from the repository.

Parameters

\GuzzleHttp\Psr7\Response $resp

response to the metadata fetch HTTP request.
